channel.title: [421]Show fps
channel.description:
Ok this will show the fps (frames per secconds) in your runescape window. Thanks to popcorn89 for the deobs and White castle for the finder thingy that you can find here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,7449.msg79239.html#msg79239
once you completed the finder thing lets find for the fps change [Code] finder.find("variable"); [/Code] to [Code] finder.find("fps"); [/Code]
than compile and run if it's right fps will be found in the classes: Class39_Sub5_Sub3.java and Class21.java
now open up Class39_Sub5_Sub3.java and search for fps and you will see [Code] aClass50_2252 = Class39_Sub5_Sub8.method479("::fpson", 255); [/Code]
now u search for aClass50_2252 and you will see that its in Class39_Sub5_Sub3.java and in Class39_Sub10_Sub1.java
So now open Class39_Sub10_Sub1.java and search for the aClass50_2252 and you will see [Code] if (Class39_Sub5_Sub9.aClass50_2469.method872 (true, Class39_Sub5_Sub3.aClass50_2252)) Class39_Sub5_Sub5.aBoolean2294 = false; (or true dont remember doesn't cares) [/Code] now go to Class39_Sub5_Sub5.java and search for aBoolean2294 and now change the false to true compile your deob run it and you will see your fps =-) i don't know if there is another way and i know its kinda noobish its the first time i searched for something and edited it by myself.. :rolleyes:
you can't do ::fpson or ::fpsoff its just on all the time dont know how to make that work yet...
PS. Can someone explain me how u can see the fps: if you dont find fps: in all the classes :confused:

item.title: [421]Show fps
item.dc:creator: @bentski bentski
item.description:
@bentski wrote:

Open Class65.java and search for something like

int i1 = 0xffff00; if(Class10_Sub2.anInt1744 < 30 && Class41.aBoolean964) i1 = 0xff0000;
I used jad, i1 is something like i_1_ in jode I think.

So here’s color codes.

the only fps that u can find is from fpson and fpsoff so i dont really get it
'fps:' is now 'Fps:' search in lowercase

Read full topic

item.title: [421]Show fps
item.dc:creator: @alowaniak alowaniak
item.description:
@alowaniak wrote:

i dont get where i can edit the fps: in the old client i made it black cause that looks cooler but now i cant find the fps: and where u can change the collors cause the only fps that u can find is from fpson and fpsoff so i dont really get it

Read full topic

Showing fps is the first thing I've done

If they thought changing 16 to -969277456 they have another thing coming, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: [421]Show fps
item.dc:creator: @bentski bentski
item.description:
@bentski wrote:

Easy way:
Open Class65.java and replace

if(Class39_Sub5_Sub5.aBoolean2294) {

to

if(!Class39_Sub5_Sub5.aBoolean2294) {

Showing fps is the first thing I’ve done

18 fps YAY! going to buy new pc

Even npcs bows to me

Read full topic

item.title: [421]Show fps
item.dc:creator: @alowaniak alowaniak
item.description:
@alowaniak wrote:

Yeah i know it checks moderator i can remember that from other client but the problem is that evrything switched to all different classes first all of the checks moderator and stuff was in client what it made a lot easyier to search

and i ment with the fps: that you cant find it in anny of the classes (srry for my bad english)
The only fps you find is from ::fpson and ::fpsoff but you cant find the fps: to show so i don’t get how you can see it then unless the fps: must be serverside but than you couldn’t let it show right?

Another question

if (Class39_Sub5_Sub9.aClass50_2469.method872
				    (true, Class39_Sub5_Sub3.aClass50_2252))
				    Class39_Sub5_Sub5.aBoolean2294 = false;

Does this mean that if Class39_Sub5_Sub9.aClass50_2469.method872 = true Class39_Sub5_Sub5.aBoolean2294 = false? and what does the Class39_Sub5_Sub3.aClass50_2252 mean?
i am used to see an if like:

if(Class39_Sub5_Sub9.aClass50_2469.method872 = true) Class39_Sub5_Sub5.aBoolean2294 = false;

or does it mean that both the if both the classes are true the boolean is false?

Read full topic

item.title: [421]Show fps
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

PS. Can someone explain me how u can see the fps: if you dont find fps: in all the classes Confused

Why would it have to be in more than one class? That’s the beauty of object oriented programming ;).

you can't do ::fpson or ::fpsoff its just on all the time dont know how to make that work yet...

I think it checks if your a moderator before letting you do that. Shouldn’t be hard to fix ;). If you have trouble I can help :P.

Read full topic

item.title: [421]Show fps
item.dc:creator: @alowaniak alowaniak
item.description:
@alowaniak wrote:

Ok this will show the fps (frames per secconds) in your runescape window.
Thanks to popcorn89 for the deobs and White castle for the finder thingy that you can find here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,7449.msg79239.html#msg79239

once you completed the finder thing lets find for the fps
change

finder.find("variable");

to

finder.find("fps");

than compile and run
if it’s right fps will be found in the classes: Class39_Sub5_Sub3.java and Class21.java

now open up Class39_Sub5_Sub3.java and search for fps
and you will see

aClass50_2252 = Class39_Sub5_Sub8.method479("::fpson", 255);

now u search for aClass50_2252 and you will see that its in Class39_Sub5_Sub3.java and in Class39_Sub10_Sub1.java

So now open Class39_Sub10_Sub1.java and search for the aClass50_2252
and you will see

if (Class39_Sub5_Sub9.aClass50_2469.method872
				    (true, Class39_Sub5_Sub3.aClass50_2252))
				    Class39_Sub5_Sub5.aBoolean2294 = false; (or true dont remember doesn't cares)

now go to Class39_Sub5_Sub5.java and search for aBoolean2294 and now change the false to true
compile your deob run it and you will see your fps =-) i don’t know if there is another way and i know its kinda noobish its the first time i searched for something and edited it by myself… :rolleyes:

you can’t do ::fpson or ::fpsoff its just on all the time dont know how to make that work yet…

PS. Can someone explain me how u can see the fps: if you dont find fps: in all the classes

Read full topic
